channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah looks at how carpenters have used their talents to transform buildings such as Stokesey Castle, Little Moreton Hall and Harvington Hall.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
channel.desc: Meeting the teams above and below ground who keep everything moving through the tunnel.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Barcelona
channel.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover Barcelona through its art and architecture, including the frescoes that inspired Miro and a surprising collection of vintage fans.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Henry VIII
channel.desc: Jonathan Foyle looks for clues in Henry VIII's art to glimpse what was going on inside the king's head as he faced his darkest days following his divorce and break with Rome.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sky at Night
channel.desc: The team delve into the world of astronaut training, discovering what it takes to become a European Space Agency astronaut. With special guest Helen Sharman.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Professor Angie Hobbs Remembers
channel.desc: The Great Philosophers. Professor Angie Hobbs gives a modern view on Bryan Magee's highly influential 1987 series.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Myles Burnyeat looks at Plato, the first western philosopher whose written works have survived.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Martha Nussbaum looks at Aristotle, Plato's star pupil and tutor to the young Alexander the Great, whose philosophy dominated western thought for many hundreds of years.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Bryan Magee and guest Anthony Kenny discuss the work of the medieval philosophers and the contribution of figures such as St Augustine and Thomas Aquinas.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah looks at how carpenters have used their talents to transform buildings such as Stokesey Castle, Little Moreton Hall and Harvington Hall.

channel.desc: Meeting the teams above and below ground who keep everything moving through the tunnel.

channel.title: Barcelona
channel.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover Barcelona through its art and architecture, including the frescoes that inspired Miro and a surprising collection of vintage fans.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah travels to Scotland to demonstrate the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
channel.desc: Exploring why two tunnels are better than one.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: The Goods find new ways to put their loom to good use, while Margo and Jerry are preparing for an important dinner party at which Jerry's boss will announce his retirement.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Hacker prepares to make his first broadcast as prime minister, announcing his grand new defence policy, but he finds it is not so easy to speak on camera.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff
channel.desc: Robert Robinson hosts a game of word definitions and deceptions. Captains Frank Muir and Patrick Campbell are joined by Tom Baker, Alan Coren, Gabrielle Drake and Miriam Stoppard.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mr Nobody Against Putin - Storyville
channel.desc: A Storyville documentary that follows a Russian schoolteacher as he risks everything to expose rising militarism in his classroom.
